optionalFeatureTypes.TL:CotN: The Lord; Champion of the Night

items: You gain {@sense tremorsense} of 60 feet. (tremorsense doesn't not substitute sight for the purposes that require you to see a creature).

items.name: Walls Have Ears
entries: Using your action, you touch your ear on an adjacent wall. You feel the vibration of each creature talking in a 150 feet radius that is within 10 feet of a wall. The walls must have a physical path connecting them. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency bonus per long rest.

items: For a number of turns equal to your proficiency bonus, you can concentrate on two spells instead of one. After the duration, the one that was first cast, expires.
While concentrating on two spells, the DC for saving throws to maintain concentration is 10 + the sum of spell slot levels used in the two spells, or half the damage taken, whichever is higher.
After the end of a long rest, you can temper a melee weapon to increase its damage by 1. Each individual weapon can be modified once.

Additionally, choose an amount of armor equal to your proficiency, you temper armor to have temporary protection. Each armor tempered gives to the wearer temporary hit points according to its type: Light: equal to the highest class level of the wearer. Medium: two times the highest class level of the wearer. Heavy: three times the highest class level of wearer. Each armor can be tempered once.
You gain proficiency in {@skill Survival}.
When facing a creature for the first time, you can make a {@skill Survival} check to find its mostly deadly, non-spell feature.
During the first round of combat, you have resistance to all damage.
Damage inflicted with the chosen weapons increases by 2.
Once per round, when holding one of those weapons and getting hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make an attack against your attacker.
Whenever you roll damage for a spell, you can reroll a number of damage equal to your spellcasting modifier. You must keep the new results.
Whenever you learn a new spell, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 20 you can learn an additional spell that meets the same requirements as the spell that triggered the roll.
You swap out one skill proficiency you had for expertise in two skills that you already are proficient with.
A number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus of your choice, have advantage on initiative rolls.

When another creature that you can see within 30 feet makes an opportunity attack, you can use your reaction to give them advantage and +5 on the damage. If the attack misses, you regain your reaction.
You gain proficiency in {@skill History} and {@skill Survival}. If you already are proficient, you gain expertise instead.
Once per round, when you hit with a bludgeoning melee weapon, you can deal extra damage equal to your Strength + Constitution modifier.
While you are below 50% of your max hp, allies within 30 feet of you have a +2 bonus on their saving throws.
While you are below 30% of your max hp, allies within 30 feet of you have their speed increased by 10 feet.
While you are below 10% of your max hp, allies within 30 feet of you can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Dodge} action as a bonus action.
While you are below or at 0 hp, allies within 30 feet of you can move half their speed as a reaction.
When you die, each ally within 30 feet is affected by the {@spell bless} spell for {@dice 3d10} days. If you come back to life the effect ends.
When you spend one or more hours of uninterrupted talking with a single creature, you bestow them the following:
Temporary HP equal to your highest class level + your charisma modifier.
Advantage against {@condition frightened|fear} effects until the next day
Advantage on all attacks on the first round of each combat, until the next day.
Advantage on their first death saving throw, until the next day.
Advantage on the first initiative check, until the next day.
You have a +5 bonus on initiative rolls.
Standing up from prone costs you 5 feet of movement.
Your walking speed increases by 5.
Your melee weapon attacks gain +1 to the damage for each adjacent ally to you.
You can use 10 feet of movement to swap places with a willing, adjacent ally. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks for either of you.
Damage you take that is less than two times your Constitution modifier, cannot disrupt your concentration
Your natural way with words leaves everyone irritated. Creatures within 10 feet of you suffer a -3 penalty to attack rolls as long as their Intelligence is higher than 3 and they can understand you.

Your level of annoyance has become a taunting mechanism. Whenever an ally within 30 feet of you is targeted by a ranged attack or spell you can use your reaction to swap the targeting to yourself. If it's an AoE spell, you become the center. The attack must be able to see you and hear you and the attack/spell's limitations still apply.

Whenever you cast spell of 1st level or higher that deals acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder damage a swirling aura of that element forms around you in 10 feet radius, until the start of your next turn  Enemies that enter or start their turn in the aura, take elemental damage of that type that equal to two times the spell slot level that was used.

foundryEffects.name: Shield Artist Adjacent Ally AC Bonus

items: When you hit with a one-handed melee weapon and your other hand is holding a shield, you can forgo half of your damage and get a bonus to AC equal to your Strength modifier until the start of your next turn.
At the end of your turn, if you haven't moved during that turn, an adjacent ally gets a +2 bonus to their AC as long as they are within 5 feet of you.
As a bonus action, you can swap the damage type of your next spell as following:
Radiant <> Necrotic
Fire <> Cold
Thunder <> Lightning
Acid <> Force
Poison <> Psychic
Whenever you damage a creature with a damage type that is vulnerable to, you gain temporary hit points equal to your highest class level.

When a non-abjuration spell that targets you and only you is cast, you can use your reaction to make an {@skill Arcana} check. If the {@skill Arcana} check is higher than 10 + the spell's level, you choose to negate either the damage or the rest of the spell's effects. If the {@skill Arcana} check is higher than 14 + the spell level, you negate both. If the {@skill Arcana} check is higher than 20 + the spell's level, you deflect the spell back to the caster.

otherSummary.entry: proficiency with at least 4 piercing weapons

foundryEffects.name: Twist the Blade Piercing Damage Bonus

items: Whenever you hit a creature with a melee weapon that deals piercing damage, the damage increases by an amount equal to your Proficiency Bonus.
While wielding a weapon with the Reach property, creatures provoke opportunity attacks when entering your reach instead of leaving.
Opportunity attacks deal 2 damage for each 5 feet the creature moved to enter your reach.

You can take the {@action Help} Action as a bonus action and the range becomes 30 feet. If the assisted character fails, you can spend your reaction to move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
Whenever you spend a certain amount of gold within a settlement, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: 1000+ Gold
entries: The trader starts to remember you, is willing to share beneficial (but not secret) information, recommend you to other traders or reserve products or services for you.

items.name: 5000+ Gold
entries: Your name starts to become known amongst traders in that settlement. You start getting discounts or custom orders.

items.name: 10000+ Gold
entries: You have become a known wealthy individual. People are eager to be in your good side and are more keen on doing favors for you. Your opinion on social or economical matters is weighted heavily (unless you have a bad reputation for other reasons).

items.name: 25000+ Gold
entries: Traders will consider loaning gold to you and it's quite easy for you to purchase valuable real estate in the settlement. People are more than happy to work for you or be employed by you.

items.name: 100000+ Gold
entries: If there is opportunity for new leadership in the settlement, you are the most favorable candidate for every trader and simple citizen.

items: You gain proficiency in {@skill Religion}.
Pick a {@5etools deity|deities.html}. You acquire an amulet or emblem that proves your faith. Faithful of the same deity have no doubt you are one of them.
You can make a {@skill Religion} check in place of any other {@dice d20} roll. You can use this ability a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down).
Once per day you can use Divine Smite at level 2 at no cost of spell slots (regardless whether you are Paladin or not).
As a bonus action, you gain hp equal to your {@skill Religion} bonus. (5 uses, recharge on long rest)
The times you can use Divine Smite per day equal to your {@skill Religion} bonus.
Creatures with beliefs opposite of your deity, have {@chance 15|15%} of being {@condition frightened} of you when they see you. The effect lasts for a day.
When damage would reduce you to 0 hp or lower, make a {@skill Religion} check. You gain that many temporary hit points before reducing your hp lower than 1.
All your attacks deal +3 radiant damage.
Saving throws against your spells that deal radiant damage have a -5 penalty.
At the start of your long rest, you may pose a question to your deity. During your rest, omens show as answers, or a cryptic dream.

choose.entry: Increase one ability score of your choice by 1. This increase allows your score to go over 20.

items: You can take this feat multiple times. On the 2nd and 4th time you choose this feat, your maximum hp increases by four times your Constitution modifier.
Once per long rest, you can reroll an attack roll, ability check or saving throw of a score that is higher than 20 (this effect does not stack)

When you have no spell slots left, you can attempt to cast a spell. Choose the level of spell slot (maximum 5th level) as normal, then roll a {@dice d100} and consult the following table. X is the spell slot level of the spell.
When you roll on the {@table Desperate Caster|NED} table, add 9 to the result. Treat any result above 100 as 100.
The maximum spell level increases from 5th to 7th.
If you spend {@dice 1d4} days in a settlement, you can determine a profitable way to make money in that area.
Each day you find dropped coins around the areas you pass. At the end of each day you find {@dice 1d12} x your level worth of gold pieces.

feat.name: Brothers in Arms

foundryEffects.name: Brothers in Arms Adjacent Attack Bonus
Brothers in Arms Flanking Attack Bonus

entries: {@b {@i IMPORTANT: This feature requires {@color two (or more) separate characters|ff0000} having it to function!}}

items: When adjacent to one of your brothers you gain +2 to your weapon attacks, and you can split any bludgeoning, piercing or slashing (magical or not) damage that you take between you and your brother.
If you're flanking a creature with one of your brothers, you gain +4 to your weapon attacks.
Decrease one random ability score by 3 and another one by 1. If it would decrease it to 0 or lower, randomize again until a higher one is picked.
You always pass your first two death saving throws.

otherSummary.entry: Access to spell slots of 3rd level or higher

items: When you cast a spell and you are adjacent to another spellcaster with this feat, you can use spell slots of the adjacent spell caster to fuel your spell (provided they are willing). If you do so, choose one of the following:
One of the two spellcasters, spends the appropriate level of spell slot for the spell. If it is a concentration spell, you must maintain it, and your spellcasting DC is taken into account.
Both spellcasters spend the appropriate (same) level of the spell. The spell then is upcasted 1 level higher. You choose which spellcasting DC is taken into account and who is concentrating on it.

When you cast a spell using a spell slot on your turn, you can choose to take a penalty to the spell attack roll equal to your proficiency bonus. If the attack hits, it deals additional damage equal to two times your proficiency bonus. You can affect up to 2 spell attack rolls per turn. This limit increases to 3 at level 11.
Reducing a creature to 0 hit points with Spellslinger allows you to cast a cantrip as a bonus action.
Taking the {@action Dash} action grants you half your current speed as extra movement.
Difficult terrain doesn't slow you down.
You can move through hostile creatures, and creatures have disadvantage on opportunity attacks made against you.
You also gain advantage on the next Dexterity saving throw you make before the start of your next turn.
You gain proficiency with {@skill Nature} and {@skill Animal Handling}.
You can cast {@spell speak with animals} or {@spell speak with plants} a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.
Docile beasts consider you a friend.
You gain a bonus to your initiative equal to your proficiency bonus.
Choose a creature type (Aberration, Beast, Celestial, Construct, Dragon, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, Giant, Monstrosity, Ooze, Plant, Undead).
As long as you're not {@condition incapacitated}, you know when one or more creatures of the chosen type are within 60 feet of you.
You have advantage on Wisdom checks to perceive (Perception) and track (Survival) creatures of the chosen type.
You have advantage on attacks against creatures of the chosen type that you can see.

feat.name: Combat Medic
entries: While touching a creature, you can use your action to make a Medicine check. The creature is stabilized, gains 1 HP (if you have a Healer's Kit, the HP equals 1d10), and temporary HP equal to your Medicine check (up to a maximum of 20). If the result is higher than 20, you also regain a spell slot equal to half your proficiency modifier (rounded down). You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Bloodthirsty
entries: Whenever you become Bloodied, you gain Bloodthirsty for 5 rounds, granting the following abilities:

items: When you hit a creature with a melee attack, you may spend 1 Hit Die to deal additional damage to that creature equal to the roll + your Constitution modifier.
When taking damage from a creature's melee attack, you may make a free melee attack against that creature. You can use this trait up to 3 times per round.

When damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you can make a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 + the damage taken). On a success, you instead drop to 1 hit point. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
Whenever you make a Dexterity saving throw to avoid damage, regardless of success or failure, reduce the damage taken by an amount equal to your Dexterity modifier.
You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks.
Whenever you take fall damage, you can reroll an amount of dice equal to your Dexterity modifier.
Once per combat, you can impose disadvantage on an opportunity attack against you.

feat.name: Vitality Channeler
entries: During a short rest, you can opt to expend your Hit Die to instead recover spell slots. The level of spell slot recovered is determined by the number of Hit Die expended: 2xHD per Spell Slot Level; 2HD = 1st level, 4HD = 2nd level, etc. You may only regain 1 spell slot of each level in this way and can only recover spell slots up to level 5.

items: You gain expertise in Riding, {@skill Nature} or {@skill Animal Handling}.
You can cast {@spell commune with nature}, {@spell beast sense} and {@spell locate animals or plants} once per long rest.

You can use a bonus action to drink one healing potion/elixir instead of an action. If you do so, you gain the maximum healing of the potion. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your highest class level per long rest.
Gain proficiency with Appraisal, {@skill Arcana}, and {@skill History}.
You learn the Arcane language.
You can cast spells through spell scrolls as if they were on your spell list. If they are not, the spellcasting modifier is Intelligence; otherwise, it's your designated spellcasting attribute.
Once per long rest, when you see another creature casting a spell, you can use your reaction to give the target(s) a +2 to their saving throws if they are within 60 feet of you.

On your turn, if you have hit the same target with two or more melee attacks, you can cast {@spell shocking grasp} on the same target as a bonus action. The spellcasting modifier of {@spell shocking grasp} is +3 or your Intelligence modifier, whichever is higher.
If 5 or more melee attacks land on the same target, you gain an extra bonus action that you can use only to cast {@spell shocking grasp} again (even if you have done so already).

feat.name: Careless Assailant
entries: On your turn, before your first attack, you can roll a d8. Until the start of your next turn, you suffer a -2 penalty to your AC and you can apply the number rolled as extra damage on a number of melee attacks equal to your proficiency bonus. Unarmed strikes get half of the bonus damage rounded down.

items: You can use the {@action Help} action as a bonus action.
You can use your reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you makes a saving throw to give that creature advantage on the roll. You can use this feature once per long rest.

table.name: Desperate Caster
rows: The spell misfires dangerously. You take X{@dice d10} psychic damage. The damage cannot be reduced in any way.
The spell fizzles and you are {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.
After the spell is cast, you drop {@condition unconscious} for X days.
After the spell is cast, you gain X levels of {@condition exhaustion}.
The spell's effectiveness is one quarter of its intended. (rounded down).
The spell's effectiveness is halved. (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: The Lord
entries: You have made a pact with an infamous vampire lord. Whether through direct confrontation, a blood letter or a bat messenger, a deal was offered and you took it. The powerful vampire has bestowed you a sliver of its dreadful powers to test your usefulness and potential. Other vampires or vampiric creatures recognize the bond that you share and either respect it, fear it or envy it. You might have not turned into a vampire but you're one step away, provided that your patron agrees with it as well. You and other children of the night serve under the Lord's patronage and secretly mingle with the mortals to further advance the Lord's ambitions. The prospects of immortality, supernatural abilities and the ticket to a new society excite you and push you forward in this pact.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Lord lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Mortals' Bane
entries: You learn the {@spell primal savagery|XGE} cantrip, which now always sharpens your teeth into fangs. You can cast it as a bonus action and it deals necrotic damage instead of acid. On successful hits, you regain hit points equal to your warlock level. If a successful hit kills a creature, you also gain temporary hp equal to the damage dealt.

As a reaction you can add your Charisma modifier to your AC when you are being attacked by a humanoid. You do so, before the results of the attack roll are known. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hypnotic Bite
entries: Once per day, you can cast {@spell suggestion} without expending a spell slot, at a creature you have bitten in the last 24h. On a failed saving throw, the creature feels compelled to pursue the course of action for the rest of its life or until you use this feature again. Other limitations or requirements of {@spell suggestion} apply normally.

subclassFeature.name: Apex Predator
entries: You've slowly become an apex predator at night. While you are not in bright light, you have advantage on {@skill Perception}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Stealth}, {@skill Sleight of Hand}, {@skill Intimidation} and initiative checks. You can also smell blood up to 150 feet away.

subclassFeature.name: Champion of the Night
entries: You seek to strengthen your pact by forming a more direct contract with your Lord's champions. You get the benefits of the chosen champion.

spell.name: Oil Shower
entries: Oil splashes against a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw or be drenched in oil. On a fail, the creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws for 1 minute. During this time, each time it moves 10 feet or more, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. The creature can spend 2 actions to clear the oil from itself. When cast at a higher level than 2, the number of targets increases by 1.

spell.name: Weakening Field
entries: Weakening magic fills the area, causing creatures within the designated area to treat any rolls made with Strength of 15 or higher as a 14. Undead and creatures with 25 or more Strength are immune.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every 2 levels above 2nd, you can exclude a creature of your choice from the field's effects.

spell.name: Invoke Divinity
entries: The chosen creature receives a divine touch based on a random roll (roll a {@dice d12}). If the god's divine touch matches the target's deity, the effects are doubled.

rows.name: Maldos
entries: Deals {@dice 1d6} radiant damage to each adjacent enemy at the start of its turn.

rows.name: Andralte
entries: Gains {@spell sanctuary} for 1d6 turns.

rows.name: Luthien
entries: Heals for {@dice 1d6} hit points.

rows.name: Iskar
entries: Gains {@spell shield of faith} for {@dice 1d6} turns.

rows.name: Vermillion
entries: Teleports {@dice 1d6 * 5} feet to a space it can see as an immediate reaction.

rows.name: Reffelia
entries: AC increases by {@dice 1d6} on its next turn, lasting until the end of that turn.

rows.name: Laia
entries: Speed increases by {@dice 1d6 * 5} feet until the end of its next turn.

rows.name: Oromne
entries: Gains {@dice 1d6} temporary hit points

rows.name: Zeriax
entries: Gains {@dice 1d6} bonus to its attacks until the end of its next turn.

rows.name: Krevor
entries: Gains a {@dice 1d6} bonus to damage on its spells until the end of its next turn.

rows.name: Dominaria
entries: Deals {@dice 1d6} force damage to each hostile creature between 15 and 60 feet from it.

rows.name: Izalith
entries: Becomes {@condition invisible} for {@dice 1d6} turns or until it attacks/casts a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Add an extra {@dice d6} to the effect for each spell slot above the first.

spell.name: Acid Ammunition
entries: You touch 5 pieces of ammunition or 5 thrown weapons and bestow them with magical acid properties. Upon impact, the ammunition splashes acid over the target. If the hit was critical, all creatures within 5 feet of the target are also splashed. When acid splashes on a creature, it deals {@damage 1d4} acid damage.

spell.name: Poisonball
entries: Noxious gas erupts out of a point you can see within range, covering areas that are not behind cover. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 5d6} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail the save are also {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute (end of turn save ends).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Prayer of Feelings
entries: Through prayer and self-reflection, you imbue others with empathy. Choose up to 6 creatures within range. For the duration, while those creatures are within range, they have a +2 bonus on {@skill Deception}, {@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Intimidation}, and {@skill Insight} checks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The bonus increases by 1 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Magnetic Personas
entries: One of the two creatures must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be subjected to one of the following effects:

entries.name: Attraction
entries: Each creature is pushed 15 feet towards each other. If an obstacle or another creature is in the way, the movement stops there. At the end of the movement, the two creatures fall {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Repulsion
entries: Each creature is pushed 10 feet away from each other. If they hit an obstacle or another creature, they take {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage and the movement stops there. At the end of the movement, the two creatures fall {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Detect Motives
entries: Choose Past or Future. You ask the spirits which of the Fragments has or will benefit more from the creature's actions, gaining an understanding of its motives, alignment, and behavior. If you guess correctly before casting the spell, the creature has disadvantage on saving throws caused by your spells or features for the next hour. A creature targeted by this spell is not aware of the spell's effects unless it is proficient in {@skill Arcana}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Choose an additional creature for each slot level above 2nd

spell.name: Dragon-Bane
entries: Energy forms an arcane lance made specifically for fighting dragons. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is a dragon and a +5 bonus if the target is in the air. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d10} piercing damage and must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled 60 feet towards the ground.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Make an additional attack to a different creature and increase the damage by {@dice 1d10} for each slot above 4th.

spell.name: Glacial Armor
entries: A layer of reactive ice covers your body for the duration. Creatures that damage you with a melee attack must pass a Constitution saving throw or take 3 cold damage for every 6 damage you took. On a success, they take half the damage. A creature that takes more than 20 damage from this spell in a single instance must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by 3 for every 2 levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Water Palm
entries: You imbue your hands with an extreme moisturizing effect, creating intense moisture on any creature you touch that immediately freezes beneath their skin. On your turn, while the spell lasts, you can use an action to make a melee spell attack with touch range. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 2d4} cold damage and takes {@damage 1d8} lightning damage whenever it takes lightning damage until the end of your next turn. When cast in certain environments, you have a chance to regain the spell slot used.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Increases the cold damage by {@dice 1d4} for every level above 1st.

spell.name: Elemental Trifecta

components.m: a small piece of obsidian, a shard of ice, and a spark of lightning captured in a vial

entries: You unleash a burst of elemental energy, targeting up to three creatures you can see within range. Each target is affected by a different type of elemental damage. You can either choose the type of damage each target receives or roll {@dice 1d6} for each target to determine the type of damage randomly.

rows.name: Fire
entries: Dexterity saving throw. The target is set ablaze, taking {@damage 2d6} fire damage at the start of its next turn.

rows.name: Cold
entries: Constitution saving throw. The target's movement speed is halved and has vulnerability to cold damage until the end of its next turn.

rows.name: Lightning
entries: Dexterity saving throw. The target is dazed and staggered until the start of your next turn.

rows.name: Acid
entries: Dexterity saving throw. The target's AC is reduced by 2 until the end of your next turn.

rows.name: Poison
entries: Constitution saving throw. The target is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

rows.name: Force
entries: Constitution saving throw. The target is pushed 10 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage for each target increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Blood Spear

m.text: blood from a dead creature that has been killed within 24 hours or from a willing creature which takes {@dice 3d8} damage. The blood is consumed by the spell

entries: You draw and shape the blood into a spear like no other. The blood solidifies in a dark crimson material. The Blood Spear is a simple melee weapon (as a spear) which you are proficient with. On a successful attack it deals {@damage 2d6} piercing + {@damage 2d8} necrotic + your spellcasting modifier damage. You regain hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. This weapon ignores resistances but not immunities.

If the Blood Spear leaves your hands for more than 6 seconds, it liquifies into blood again. The Blood Spear has the Thrown property of 60/120 range. If thrown, it accelerates rapidly and against a bloodied creature it can never have disadvantage. On a successful thrown hit the damage is Xd6 necrotic + 10 piercing, where X is your warlock level.

spell.name: Needle Barrage
entries: You control leaves and needles from the environment to launch a barrage at a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier slashing damage.
If you are in natural outdoors environment, the attack ignores cover.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6})

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: Tenebra are considered humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: Tenebra are about the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Dweller from Below
entries: Tenebra having no eyes, have substantially different senses from surface dwellers. You have echolocation ({@sense blindsight}) out to a range of 30 feet, by emitting low frequency soundwaves. You are {@condition blinded|blind} beyond this range. Furthermore, you have {@sense tremorsense} up to 60 feet, as you are extremely sensitive to ground vibrations.

entries.name: Blind Adaptation
entries: Without eyes, your other senses have been honed to unusual heights. You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell. You are immune to effects that require you to see the origin (such as Petrifying Gaze)

entries.name: Deep Echo
entries: As a bonus action, you can emit a loud sound wave that grants you {@sense blindsight} out to 60 feet until the end of your next turn. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses after a long rest.

entries.name: Sonic Screech
entries: As an action, you can release a concentrated sonic boom in a 10-foot radius centered on yourself. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or take thunder damage equal to twice your level and become dazed until the end of its next turn (on a success, it takes half the damage and is not dazed). You can use this trait once per long rest.

entries.name: Subterranean Magic
entries: You know the {@spell thunder note|KibblesTasty:CC} or {@spell stone forming|KibblesTasty:CC} cantrip (choose at character creation). When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell earth tremor|XGE} spell once per day. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell detect thoughts} spell once per day. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can read, speak and write Common and one standard language of your choice.

entries.name: Type
entries: Druvan are considered humanoid.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Plant Sustenance
entries: As a Druvan you do not need to consume normal food. Instead, you only need to drink water, equal to about four times a normal human of your size consumes.

entries.name: Forest Bane
entries: Druvan creatures cannot use fire magic or wield weapons that resemble axes. Those tools go against their very core existence. They take 2 extra damage from fire magic and 1 extra damage from axe-like weapons.

entries.name: Nature's Vigilance
entries: While in an outdoors natural environment, you are considered proficient in Intelligence ({@skill Nature}), Wisdom ({@skill Survival}), Wisdom ({@skill Perception}), Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) ability checks. When are you in forest or foliage, you can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action (other Hiding requirements still apply).

entries.name: Laia's Legacy
entries: You know the {@spell needle barrage|NED} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell barkskin} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell seismic wave|KibblesTasty:CC} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast {@spell barkskin} or {@spell seismic wave|KibblesTasty:CC} with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level, but cannot up cast them, unless you know them via other means as well.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Sylvan.

items.name: Flight
entries: Because of your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor. You can only fly short distances.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Auran and Goblin.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Celestial.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Goblin and one standard language of your choice.

items.name: I'm not a Horse!
entries: A creature mounting the Centaur has disadvantage on attacks and saving throws. The Centaur has -2 AC if mounted.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common or Goblin and one standard language of your choice.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and one standard language of your choice.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Goblin and Gnomish.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Goblin and Dwarvish.

items.name: Trance
entries: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

Whenever you gain a level in your class, you can gain two proficiencies that you don't have, each one with a weapon or a tool of your choice selected from the Player's Handbook. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you level up again.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Elvish.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Sylvan.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common or Goblin and one standard language of your choice.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Primordial.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Primordial.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Primordial.

items.name: Cold Resistance
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Primordial.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Gith.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Gith.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Goblin and one standard language of your choice.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Giant.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Sylvan.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Goblin and one standard language of your choice.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Goblin and one standard language of your choice.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Goblin and one standard language of your choice.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common or Goblin and Draconic.

items.name: Brutal Presence
entries: When hitting a bloodied creature with your horns, you have advantage on {@skill Intimidation} checks against it until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Langauges
entries: You can speak, read and write Goblin and one standard language of your choice.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Goblin and Orc.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Sylvan.

items.name: Sea Elf Training
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item trident|phb|tridents} and {@item net|phb|nets}.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish.

items.name: Trance
entries: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

Whenever you gain a level in your class, you can gain two proficiencies that you don't have, each one with a weapon or a tool of your choice selected from the Player's Handbook. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you level up again.

items.name: Trance
entries: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

Whenever you gain a level in your class, you can gain two proficiencies that you don't have, each one with a weapon or a tool of your choice selected from the Player's Handbook. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you level up again.

items.name: Blessing of Zeriax
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You take necrotic damage equal to your highest hit die. This damage cannot be reduced or prevented. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Starting at 3rd level, you also gain resistance to all damage when you teleport using this trait. The resistance lasts until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Elvish.

items.name: Ability Score Info
entries: If you choose the option to increase two ability scores by two, you must also decrease your Dexterity, Constitution or Charisma score by 2.

entries.replace: additional benefit based on one of the following options
entries.with: additional benefit based on two of the following options

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and one standard language of your choice.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and one standard language of your choice.

raceFluff.name: Tenebra
entries: After the "War that Broke the World," a group of humans, too afraid to return to the surface due to immense losses, decided to stay underground. Over time, the intense magic of the Underdark sped up their mutation, giving them new magical capabilities while rendering their eyes useless. Their skin change to grey or purple tones, due to the lack of sunlight. These mutated humans became known as the Tenebra.

entries.name: Reputation
entries: The Tenebra maintained contact with surface dwellers for supplies in their early years but eventually became largely forgotten by many surface civilizations. They kept the most contact with the Tritons, who lived at or visited the ocean depths and Drow Elves that also dwelled underground but usually higher than the Tenebra, often acting as middlemen between Tenebra and the surface races. Due to their unusual appearance and rare existence, when they surface and mingle with other races, they usually wear blindfolds to draw less attention and not intimidate the surface dwellers.

raceFluff.name: Druvan

images.title: Druvan that grew up near the influence of good aligned mortals, ending up switching to the Good alignment.
Druvan that grew up near the influence of evil mortals, embracing the Evil alignment as their own.

entries: The Emerald Fragment, Laia, conceived the Druvan people as an integral part of her grand plan. These unique beings, unlike the hasty emergence of other races, patiently slumbered beneath the earth's surface as seeds for countless millennia. When the dawn of the 2nd age arrived, and mortals successfully pushed Dragons away from their burgeoning civilizations, the Druvan began their remarkable transformation. Slowly, they sprouted from the ground, adopting a humanoid form. Their divine purpose was clear: to safeguard the lush forests from the unchecked expansion of mortal cities and towns, ensuring the harmony between civilization and nature.

The origins of the Druvan are shrouded in mystique. Most Druvan individuals are not acquainted with their biological parents unless a parent decides to reveal themselves. Typically, it's a benevolent Dryad who conducts a sacred ritual, planting a cluster of seeds that will eventually blossom into Druvan individuals. These Dryads plant multiple seeds, fostering a deep bond among the Druvan, often referred to as 'seedlings.' The Druvan population remains relatively scarce compared to other races, as their reproduction occurs through an intricate, time-consuming process. This rarity makes each Druvan's existence all the more precious.

While Druvan prefer to remain within the sanctuary of their forest homes, there are instances where some of them grow up in close proximity to mortal settlements nestled within the woods. These Druvan may occasionally visit nearby towns or venture beyond the borders of their birthplace. These rare interactions with the outside world can lead to diverse experiences and perspectives among the Druvan. The Druvan who interact with mortals from a young age, usually have changed coloration on their skin hue.

Curiously, Druvan harbor an unexpected distrust of druids, often claiming that these magic-wielders draw upon the land's magic without giving back in return. Many Druvan perceive druids as takers, extracting the earth's life force without replenishing it adequately. This distrust has led to complex relationships between the two groups, with occasional tensions simmering beneath the surface.

In their humanoid form, Druvan possess skin that mimics the texture of bark, adorned with leaves that naturally sprout from their bodies, adding to their enigmatic appearance. They do not require sustenance in the form of food, but do need a substantial amount of water, roughly equivalent to the consumption of four humans their size. Their unique physiology allows them to channel the life force of the forest directly, sustaining them without the need for traditional nourishment. Interestingly, their blood resembles clear water with a subtle, light-blue undertone, reflecting their deep connection to the element of water and the lifeblood of nature itself.

entries.name: Origins
entries: Laia was the main creator of the Druvan, with Oromne and Maldos adding some touches of their own to their design. A Druvan that is raised among humanoids from a young age often features a change in its morality, affected by their social circles, which also affects their skin coloration. Druvan who learn to be good and altruistic, get vibrant tones on their skin and leaves, while those who embrace the evil of mortals, get a blighted, gray tone on their body.

entries.name: Genetics
entries: As creatures of the forest, Druvan have little understanding of the other mortals' morality regarding good or evil. They have natural lawful tendencies, following the ways of the forest.

entries.name: Lİfespan
entries: Druvan live up to 400 years.

entries.name: Homeland
entries: Druvan come for areas with thick untouched forests, such as Razorleaf, Wildlands, TorNav'Roc, NightWatch, Eratus and the north Savage Lands.

entries.name: Also found in
entries: Unified Caldar

entries.name: Reputation
entries: Those mysterious creatures of the forest are often viewed as a sign that the nearby forests have been disturbed and Laia has called them to take action.

entries.name: Alive/Extinct
entries: As of the 4th era, Druvan are still alive.

items.name: Languages:
items.entry: Two of your choice between Elvish, Dwarvish, Gith, or Orc

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: A {@item holy symbol|phb}, a prayer {@item book|phb}, 5 sticks of incense, vestments, a set of {@item common clothes|phb}, and a {@item pouch|phb} containing 10 gp

entries.name: Feature: Together as One
entries: People of the Eratus have learned that together they can face anything. Under Arzen's banner the empire is able to face even the worst enemies. Whenever you make a saving throw to resist an effect that would make you {@condition frightened} and you can see at least one more creature with the same background, you have a +2 bonus to those saving throws.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: A {@item hunting trap|phb}, 5 {@item rations (1 day)|phb|rations}, {@item hempen rope (50 feet)|phb|50 ft of hempen rope} and a {@item pouch|phb} containing 10gp

entries.name: Feature: On the Move
entries: You have learnt to pack fast, travel efficiently and hide well from the monsters of this world. Whenever you are being followed or tracked you know how to leave false tracks behind and cause impediments to your pursuers.

items.name: Languages:
entries: One of your choice between the standard languages.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: A set of {@item fine clothes|phb}, an elven tattoo, a {@item book|phb} of elven poetry, and a {@item pouch|phb|purse} containing 25 gp

entries.name: Feature: Forgotten Wisdom
entries: Those who live with the elves often are granted access to the Library. Lore from a world that has ended, has been saved and meticulously archived there. You have a +3 to {@skill History} checks to recall lore and if your check fails you have {@chance 50|50%} chance of knowing someone that might know more.

items.name: Languages:
entries: One of your choice between the standard languages.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: A set of {@item fine clothes|phb}, an official identity document, a scroll of pedigree, and a {@item pouch|phb|purse} containing 15 gp

entries.name: Feature: Protector of the Land
entries: Your ancestors have gone to great lengths and fought countless battles to protect these lands from invading humanoids and monsters alike. You know the land and can use it to your benefit. You know the most advantageous positions for combat in the area and you have advantage on checks to find your way when in the wilds of Unified Caldar.

optionalfeature.name: Night Huntress
entries: When in contract with the Night Huntress, you gain the following benefits.

items: Your speed increases by 20.
You can cast {@spell hunter's mark} once per day without expending a spell slot. Your Eldritch Blast also triggers Hunter's Mark damage.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Caller
entries: When in contract with the Blood Caller, you gain the following benefits.

items: Whenever a creature within 15 feet of you takes slashing or piercing damage, you can use your reaction to cast a spell that targets only that creature.
Whenever you reduce a creature to less than 50% hp with a spell, you gain resistance to all damage from that creature until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Crimson Lancer
entries: When in contract with the Crimson Lancer, you gain the following benefits.

items: You learn the {@spell blood spear|NED} spell.

Whenever you kill a creature with your {@spell blood spear|NED}, each creature of your choice within 60 feet, must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of you for 1 min. Those creatures can repeat the saving throws at the end of each of their turns.

optionalfeature.name: Mist Warrior
entries: When in contract with the Mist Warrior, you gain the following benefits.

items: If damage would reduce your hp to 0 or lower it reduces it to 1 instead and you automatically cast {@spell gaseous form} on yourself without expending a spell slot. You gain temporary hit points equal to two times your warlock level and they last until the spell ends. You regain the use of this feature after a long rest.
A shroud of mist surrounds you when the light transitions. While in dim light conditions you can use a bonus action to take the {@action Dodge} action.

system.activation.condition: When a creature makes an opportunity attack
When you are attacked by a humanoid
